5AEE1DFEA3264736A02FD544E52A49D2.description: Deliver presentations on problems and solutions that theorize on the causes and effects of each problem, establish connections between the defined problem and at least one solution, and offer persuasive evidence to support the definition of the problem and the proposed solutions

B4FB5E2187B14356A3AA2A8B555A0C94.description: Make persuasive presentations that provide a clear statement of the position, include relevant evidence, offer a logical sequence of information, engage the listener and try to gain acceptance of the proposition or proposal

C9D06FD9FD9248E8B5D7511B682B8545.description: Provide oral responses to literature that develop an interpretation showing careful reading, understanding, and insight; organize the presentation around several clear ideas, premises or images, develop and justify the interpretation through the use of examples from the text

CBF8882A7FC8403D84E49F6627EAB796.description: Deliver descriptive presentations that use concrete sensory details to set forth and support unified impressions of people, places, things or experiences

6A2DF8C68267468D9818E101F6584E43.description: Give informative presentations that pose relevant questions sufficiently limited in scope to be completely and thoroughly answered through development of the topic with facts, details, examples, and explanations from multiple authoritative sources, including speakers, periodicals, and online information

C0CB037A758248EB8A3DEC45E236793D.description: Deliver narrative presentations that establish a context, plot, and point of view, including sensory details and specific language to develop the plot and character, use a range of narrative devices, including dialogue, tension or suspense

55E569E22AC94D99B485A44AC3B27767.description: Recite poems, scripture passages, sections of speeches, or dramatic soliloquies using voice modulation, tone and gestures expressively to enhance the meaning

EF55720C937240E18ACF871EB916F17A.description: Determine the purpose of a presentation and apply appropriate presentation skills for the particular purpose

9946E5C85E264501B4635A122DF59541.description: Incorporate digital media and visual displays of data when helpful and in a manner that strengthens the presentation

75244CE576F84880B93BD98C5D18AA83.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate

68076C86081D40C090A3F2BD6403D1C8.description: Emphasize important points to assist the listener in following the main ideas and concepts

216AF94FCDE54C129F99AD6D01130345.description: Use effective timing, volume and tone to sustain audience interest and attention

377F53A3144A4DEEA972A2B78D899D4E.description: Select a focus, an organizational structure and a point of view, matching the purpose, message and vocal modulation to the audience

E11C032932FE45788E28C68EE14876C2.description: Present information emphasizing salient points with pertinent descriptions and details, using appropriate manners and speech, adequate volume, clear pronunciation, and use of visuals

3522B32F2F2247C99CB3E0B0FA8C6942.description: Delineate the claims made by a speaker or presenter and detail what evidence supports which claims

2FA8AF79327D4B6E84DBE19BD0620FE4.description: Provide helpful feedback to speakers concerning the coherence and logic of a speech’s content and delivery and its overall impact on the listener

9C62516EAA8749219968614B6A925920.description: Identify the tone, mood and emotion conveyed in the oral communication and relate the speaker’s verbal communication to the nonverbal message

C43691BB1AC24CE2BFA38D549AFC2C6E.description: Identify the tone, mood and emotion conveyed in the oral communication and relate the speaker’s verbal communication to the nonverbal message

8A7AA8D2E405486EA01236BBEE893C1D.description: Explain how the information presented clarifies and contributes to a topic or issue under study

BCA4DE2A2A954F289CF47DFCA4D4B722.description: Analyze, evaluate and interpret information presented in visual or multimodal formats

279FF0DB8D484C618262CD06116716F8.description: Demonstrate respect for the view of others assessing new ideas against Catholic values

D0BADC460F8748F8BBF44EA392BEEDAD.description: Review the key ideas expressed and extend their own ideas in light of new information learned

1D6F356BE5584E8BA7E8016F54898E86.description: Build on the ideas of others by asking relevant questions and contributing appropriate and essential information

EDCB86D9D9EF405C99C49D84EDC71311.description: Cooperate with peers to set clear goals and deadlines

0B2A8E9289DD4417A4BAC0C30B7C1CDD.description: Ask questions that seek information not already discussed

C6397C9B61D74C409F5748F87C5447A9.description: Prepare for discussions by completing reading or conducting research and explicitly draw on that material in discussion

E51E7EF728ED437DA62C5F5637F4D9C9.description: Initiate and engage in group discussions on sixth grade topics and texts being studied in class

EF2FCD25FE694AC0BA5C48F9CA5867DB.description:
Speaking and Listening: Comprehension and Collaboration
Students adjust their use of spoken language to communicate effectively with a variety of audiences and for different purposes.

1DEDC9BBE7784608BA1203E93DEAE7C8.description: Identify and properly use parallelism to present ideas in a series and items juxtaposed for emphasis

1CC70FEF811F4E43B80644CAC61FE527.description: Use a variety of complex transitions between sentences to build coherency within paragraphs

D927EC7B81A64E8BA953470D4FDC5354.description: Use effective coordination and subordination of ideas, including both main ideas and supporting details in single sentences to express complete thoughts

9837C48D2A5244459E3ED1D9120892B5.description: Identify and correctly use phrases, prepositional phrases, appositives, main clauses, and subordinate clauses

DBBEB30EA0D34AE7BDBB7CC4160EA945.description: Use simple, compound and complex sentences

0920C0EA61554A3596F67553A6C79443.description: Use appropriate and varied sentence types to develop paragraphs

19F687467C034B5DA90C9283D8E5F7A9.description: Use an apostrophe to form possessive nouns and contractions

72FA2D8185104E7490889A638003AF67.description: Demonstrate the use of quotation marks

BDAB8ACCC4E64B8AB3558A5C22814A70.description: Use commas to separate coordinate adjectives (e.g. It was a fascinating, enjoyable movie, but not he wore and old green shirt.)

21F181FAA158416A839D8E1AB9439A3E.description: Use a comma before the conjunction in a compound sentence, use a semi-colon to connect main clauses

FC1429E964334986AACDE501468C3809.description: Use a comma, colon and semi- colon, hyphen, dash, parentheses, and bracketing appropriately

671CB1FD1AB0473A98D98CC9E770F568.description: Observe conventions of capitalization, punctuation, and spelling

D1651694429F41FCB8FEBC82C467360B.description: Identify and correctly use verbs that agree with compound subjects

5E6C24FED5E944C884E9E809CE6EB6A9.description: Identify and properly use present perfect, past perfect, and future perfect verb tenses

6D9E0CD11C67418392DC5266B1EFE415.description: Identify and use relative pronouns, intensive/reflexive, possessive, demonstrative, and indefinite pronouns

76412D7D02F347CABFA91C86690BE81A.description: Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case (subjective, objective, possessive)

9A74F7D54AFC4FAE8C0E0E8D081F38B5.description: Identify the antecedent of the pronoun and agreement of antecedent with the pronoun

9E18E5E3A5264AF2BC6CD26C759101AC.description: Demonstrate understanding of and use of predicate nominative and predicate adjective (predicate nouns or subject complements)

313006A7DD624F78AC490E228DBD6D50.description: Iidentify and use words in the possessive case, nominative case and objective case

AA3F9A624A6F4D1093D87A1F073F6F40.description: Use nouns of direct address and appositives

808F8ED43ADA4A4FBBDA4139BAA2078D.description: Identify nouns with particular emphasis on concrete, abstract and collective nouns as a part of speech

2D07E2C7483144AEBC1A6E80D47C2508.description: Iidentify and define the functions of the parts of speech including adverbs, adjectives, interjections and conjunctions

852ABFC73EAC418EB6A83DEFE766773F.description: Observe conventions of grammar and usage in writing and speaking

05FFDD356A86462EB68755710889B014.description:
Grammar and Usage
Students adjust their use of spoken, written, and visual language (e.g., conventions, style, vocabulary) to communicate effectively with a variety of audiences and for different purposes.

1A3CA32BD8D843CE872D0E848BB51701.description: Use technology in an appropriate way, including the internet, to produce, publish and interact with others about writing, including linking to and citing online sources in order to avoid plagiarism.

466F5DD7489F4292AAB3EA7839FF2517.description: Anticipate and address reader concerns and counterarguments

B95953CD95CA498D827200EE8F568E87.description: Anticipate and address reader concerns and counterarguments

052591DA4E1D4D0D9593F218845BCFAB.description: Write persuasive compositions that state a clear position on a proposition or proposal

5B44E56F32DB44E392FEDD9A4C206B60.description: Reference standards in Reading Literature and Informational Text- Comprehension, Response and Analysis (beginning on page 29)

E480E4A6B4D3422C88D78FC948D5899E.description: Develop an interpretation that shows careful reading, understanding and insight

ABBAF060796F4E208CE8851038C0ED2C.description: Draw from text to support analysis and reflection describing what has been learned

C90DFF48CC694C0A8F2B8AF6B3F3DCB3.description: Write in response to literary or informational sources

242FED34BC154B4A8F4FB0A1C048F296.description: Provide basic bibliographic information using MLA or APA format

B57701D886C14093AFA8B77C3365328D.description: Demonstrate the distinction between one’s own ideas from the ideas of others

405B4C404E964AD09D64ED592AD48898.description: Demonstrate that sources have been evaluated for accuracy, bias and credibility

8E630979064B4EBEA46FDD3A66BEDD7C.description: Use a variety of resources and documents

71AA370501D24634925EBFA8F29EE7DB.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects

1957D09E22354B609936EFD192E704CD.description: Gather information from experience as well as print and digital resources, take notes on sources, categorize evidence, restate, summarize or paraphrase information

0E5590650779406E90F97370F22CD663.description: Write a research report that has been developed using a systematic research process

326DCB3C4FFA4626A9CBC5E0CEEE0CA9.description: Use MLA (or APA) style for bibliography

A80F336A033F445FA7A076BCF1949944.description:
Identify the need for correct citation of
sources to avoid plagiarism

48B4CD0E1E58403C9D9A7366EB8813F0.description: Provide a conclusion that follows logically from the information or explanation presented

3E43897AEFFA4793855E005BF3F4DC11.description: Use straightforward language to create an objective style, appropriate for a reader seeking information

3F8ACD3FC20A4DEB9DF19DA70E161977.description: Use appropriate links and varied sentence structures to join and clarify ideas

4D746567B8A84FD6A5E53C7DA4B080B7.description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples

C20B92EC9D244E7E922E56C938F1B211.description: Introduce a topic, state a thesis, organize information appropriate to the purpose, use strategies such as definition, classification, compare/ contrast, and cause/effect and offer evidence to support arguments and conclusions

100362ECA8F44166836CF057D90F6F57.description: Write expository, informative/explanatory, descriptive, and technical texts

50E1939B2C2D4B46B4D2D2C4BE3B8E5E.description: Provide a satisfying conclusion that follows from events, experiences, or ideas

A5E59AB1FF32411EA28FB0DF6F2340E3.description: Choose words and phrases to develop the events, experiences, and ideas precisely

4BF62525EBCA4A91A89F10044E5ECF96.description: Use a variety of transition words, phrases and clauses to convey sequence, shift from one time frame or setting to another, and/or show the relationships among the events and experiences

D7F98C1203534698AC689FE0A28F27F7.description: Develop narrative elements (e.g., setting, event sequence, characters) using relevant sensory details and devices such as dialogue or suspense

90F4C77209A441DFBD5748732DF7168A.description:
Engage and orient the reader by
establishing a context and point of view, and have an organized sequence of events or experiences

3ADC94250B724F25B25E5FC766BDCEF5.description: Email and electronic notes that portray the appropriate tone

A766379C79D9469295A311E175415391.description: Memos that portray the appropriate tone

5E62AC0815944F089E82DB82B72038ED.description: Use symbols, pictures and charts to convey thoughts and meaning in a written document

866D685F2AAD4F2F8A3B050156A18959.description: Use varied word choices to make all types of writing interesting for the reader

A526491E0C084C9EB14ED5DBAAF183A6.description: Write for different purposes; information, persuasion, description, and to a specific audience or person, adjusting tone and style as necessary

F68D0EDB308C4EF3B7E23E8C03680B36.description: Write multi-paragraph informational text that engages the interest of the reader, state a clear purpose, develop the topic with supporting details and precise language, and conclude with a detailed summary linked to the purpose of the summary

09CF78956109441DABBB108C7DAC1B45.description: Compose paragraphs that are based on information, flow from reading and describe events and observations

1AFDED4FC6034DC59C664FCEF764D685.description: Apply spelling and grammar rules to all written work

A4C7D6EFDDEB4FECBA900DD2846B3512.description: Demonstrate the ability to use punctuation to affect meaning and flow in a written piece

550C3FF88F054D2B8DB2EA2D128B1ACD.description: Emphasize content as well as mechanics in written work

F7BA4091964945668D57A324B08590CE.description: Edit and proofread one’s own writing, as well as that of others, using an editing checklist or set of rules, with specific examples of corrections of frequent errors

9AD10D8F82BF479D838742CBBBADD668.description: Eiscuss ideas for writing, keep lists of ideas, and use a graphic organizer to plan writing

EA53C979A63D46BBB01DD90EABD60275.description: Collaborate with adults and peers throughout the writing process to enhance ideas and techniques

2ADE0798F13E431DA81D02DD49BB301B.description: Revise writing to improve the organization and consistency of ideas within and between paragraphs to improve meaning and clarity.

CDE38808BEF046D0B3EAABE72138618C.description: Engage in a writing process of planning, reviewing, revising, editing, rewriting, evaluating or trying a new approach

5D6FF7BEB42F498DBEE2C03C37A6C7E2.description: Polished writing – engaged in the full writing process (plan, research, reflect, revise; first draft, second draft, final)

7B69550D62F745DCB27769D2B9F4B468.description: Readable writing – intended for an audience (essay test question, assignment –short response answers)

697FC60AA1CC45AD85F8C05332D0A223.description: Provisional writing – brief, daily writing that supports learning (brainstorming, spontaneous, routine tasks)

C07207C4719B4147A3E3205531D4058B.description: Write routinely for a range of tasks, purposes and audiences, over short and extended time frames

9A2A36A66E9E498F8FB856EDAF5BF1CC.description: Produce grade appropriate coherent, clear, and legible writing in which organization, development, substance and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience

7A2EF7E23AE546E8B491A03E423EDCD9.description:
Writing – Processes and Features
Students employ a wide range of strategies as they write and use different writing process elements appropriately to communicate with different audiences for a variety of purposes.

0518C1075C6E48168822FCAD50BFA4DA.description: Self-select appropriate texts for research and personal reading

6746A61403C84E2AAC1A26B434D9CF4B.description: Expand the use of reference materials for gathering information and develop rubric for evaluating validity of sources from web sources.

8FD9630E34EB471B90A6D4F3C05E125E.description: Apply the knowledge gained from two texts to inform the reading additional texts

E0B9825FF2B44EDDB1F76F3403EF241F.description: Assess the similarities and differences between two or more texts on the same subject.

B167F4146BE04230B2B5D194DE640F1A.description: Identify if a text or media, is fact, opinion, or propaganda

F906374354E440C993DB677C25FB6DB4.description: Distinguish among fact, opinion, propaganda, and reasoned judgment presented

300C12710EB54650803DFCBAE597BBFD.description: Analyze which details are emphasized and how the account unfolds in each version.

775930313E2A4D0FB82C9536C02345E7.description: Compare and contrast the accounts of a subject in different mediums (e.g. person’s life story told in print, video, or multimedia)

BA2B090FD4EF45EE85004FEE97943F50.description: Extend awareness of world cultures and historical perspectives through diverse texts, including first-person materials, accounts of historical events, documents and historical fiction.

7F9F873BEB1F445098A0D435C986017A.description: Compare and contrast the works of various authors

9F4F9D4B167E4050BD256E5C548BB2B9.description: Critique the credibility of characters and the degree to which a plot is believable or realistic

574AB73BC0B649A7B114C63DE42BCA9F.description: Evaluate, critique, and interpret a variety of literature from different eras, cultures and authors

7E81519695574F9B9005A1A605BFDD4E.description: Determine the causes or reasons that link different events, ideas, or information in a text, drawing on key details

830D6CCC34FB41DE91C272EB0D0A2E4E.description: Identify the effects of common literary devices such as symbolism, imagery, or metaphor in a variety of texts

15D91E620A104888B5636D8D08B78614.description: Interpret figurative and connotative meanings of words and phrases, as they are used in text, to develop meaning and tone

18A62CD857B94A69ADF81C74EC194CDA.description: Analyze how a theme or central idea develops over the course of a text, drawing on key details

0281DB80ACA5442E8D0812163846BA98.description: Identify and analyze features and themes conveyed through characters, actions and images

1B5E900659C244579345FE78353104D4.description: Analyze how the traits of the characters and the elements of the setting affect and influence the plot

F741B944DE46492CB9F4A98FB3F6AB33.description: Identify the conflict of the plot and explain how it is resolved

DD11F2C04E174254A21DA1B62A0F270F.description: Describe how a story’s plot unfolds as well as how characters adapt or change as they move toward a resolution

413A9415A1854D2A8DA63C54EAEEE2C9.description: Apply Catholic values, virtues, Catholic Social Teachings in evaluation of literary themes and plots

67833C4AC4894D2D9565137BDC5C505E.description: Interpret text using background knowledge, literary elements and inferences

804F8E098D2244FCA3B927D84865321D.description: Student will read a variety of texts and genres to build an interest in leisure, academic, and informational reading

84885253C2064C0C957A79C4302F144D.description:
Reading Literature and Informational Text - Comprehension, Response, and Analysis
Students read a wide range of print and non-print texts to build an understanding of texts, of themselves, and of the cultures of the United States and the world; to acquire new information; to respond to the needs and demands of society and the workplace; and for personal fulfillment. Among these texts are fiction and nonfiction, classic and contemporary works, and literature from many periods.

EFCCBCBCBD8348C6A0CD6D1843E58F58.description: determine the appropriateness of the evidence presented for an author’s conclusions and evaluate whether the author adequately supports inferences

5919871C6B8C46DEB5391C7DE7BD6483.description: Expository critique-Assess evidence of nonfiction and informational literature

0F5FFA5020B4419EB158409C5AF58C4E.description: Clarify an understanding of texts by creating outlines, notes, diagrams, summaries, or reports

7663E752143E4518AAC82C2BFC5345C4.description: Connect and clarify main ideas by identifying their relationships to multiple sources and related topics

B0293705C7A94DEBA0F4E8771201020D.description:
Make reasonable statements,
conclusions inferences, or predictions about a text, supporting them with evidence from the text.

828A02A8DBC24702B62DFC56D86868A1.description: Distinguish personal point of view from that of the characters or author.

D23903F91BDA42D8BD9B8F80DA5D0200.description: Identify how an author’s point of view influences the cultural context of a text

AECB0AE6C2DB488F9F05C25AFDE88C84.description: Identify how the author’s choice of words, examples, and reasons are used to persuade the reader

E5002F1C6DAF4DFFABA28B4001E2B640.description: Describe how an author establishes the point of view of the speaker or a character in a poem, drama or story

B083627F5E094B0692FA5728EE274600.description: Identify the speaker and recognize the difference between first –person and third-person narration

AA29CCB2E5DE4619B5D1C7A89C64D6EB.description: Determine point of view and cultural context on which media is portrayed

8E69888EE98147C698021ED26EF93F13.description: Explain the effect of flashback and foreshadowing on the development of the plot and meaning of the text

4019D92C3FD14DCB8E60A4A497753456.description: Compare and contrast organizational patterns of texts

D3B4B6A40E1E41189594A75D7F10A45F.description: Identify how text structure affects meaning, including chronological order, order of importance and special order

7821C22D45B24D0C82228A8F61BCB90D.description: Describe the structures an author uses to organize specific text

90AABD09905449E9B8BB10FE937E1CFC.description: Explore literature from diverse cultural backgrounds

D3155FFC9F2B4394A180DDD15E2C306B.description: Compare and contrast literal and figurative meaning of a poem

54E055EF9ACC495482506E6330C200CD.description: Recognize structure of poetry within a variety of poetic forms (e.g., acrostic, couplets, cinquain, free verse, concrete)

18FF292E35C4414F9F6E8B65D75133F8.description: Refer to core elements of stories, plays, and myths, including characters, settings, and plots, when writing or speaking about specific text

0EA8772224824558A8A0707F0ED898FC.description: Identify different types of fiction and describe the major characteristics of each form

DF81318AC13D433581DB427F177C6A54.description: Distinguish major categories and features of literary genre (e.g. stories from poems, fiction from non-fiction)

FE83605DCA314EF3AF1AEE3280FAD00E.description: Identify the structural features of media and use the features to obtain information

92345EC2AE994D9F85F188F955104A3B.description: Utilize the structural features of media and use the features to obtain information

86A2B486E7D54C28943A7A8C17BD198D.description:
Reading Literature and Informational Texts - Craft and Structure
Students apply knowledge of language structure, language conventions (e.g., spelling and punctuation), media techniques, figurative language, and genre to create, critique, and discuss print and non-print texts.

258C046486C54902A69341B37E78661C.description: Identify and interpret idioms, metaphors, similes, personification, alliteration, onomatopoeia, hyperbole and sensory language

DC2EC66BAC334C2ABA7E7BB3E0C86FD6.description: Interpret figurative and connotative meanings of words and phrases as they are used in text.

B3C81C60C00A4DE8B566A9B3C04DC532.description: Identify analogies: word and synonym, word and antonym, part and whole

FAE17DA0F7DF4F41A625D32D1FDAD6B3.description: Distinguish a word from other words with similar denotations but different connotations

764735BCBCB84C1F899233064576FF08.description: Trace the network of uses and meaning that different words have and the interrelationships among the meanings and uses

0B6A80BBCC7C4DE69670228CD620A144.description: Use the etymologies of words to understand the origins and meanings of frequently used English and foreign words in speaking and writing

96FB2FEC78C54BAAAC33DA5F1C72B6B7.description: Verify the preliminary determination of a word’s meaning (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or looking up a word in the dictionary)

6AF353D7685E4011A96086942B08DD9F.description: Verify the preliminary determination of a word’s meaning (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or looking up a word in the dictionary)

D9A1F1929CC24C6ABB3BD96D11E36BBD.description: Use known prefixes, root words, and suffixes as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., audience,auditory,audible)

FA339E5559A54DA3A4D97E998B05B383.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown or multiple-meaning words through the use of one or more strategies, such as understanding how the word is used in a sentence, analyzing the word’s sound, spelling, and meaningful parts; consulting glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital

B8559B4A42984082987C1F9B26FCD48E.description: Determine word meaning (based on grade six reading)

669227BA946B4BB8972A68F65AC4E47F.description:
Vocabulary Development and Word Analysis
Students apply a wide range of strategies to comprehend, interpret, evaluate, and appreciate texts. They draw on their prior experience, their interactions with other readers and writers, their knowledge of word meaning and of other texts, their word identification strategies and understanding textual features (e.g. sound-letter correspondence, sentence structure, context, graphics).
